bug.author: b1ueshad0w
bug.summary: fail to install horovod (cmake error, Could NOT find CUDA)
bug.description:
Environment:
Framework: (TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, MXNet) TensorFLow Framework version: 1.15.0 Horovod version: 0.20.3 MPI version: Open MPI 4.0.0 CUDA version: 10.1 NCCL version: 2.7.8 (nccl-repo-rhel7-2.7.8-ga-cuda10.1-1-1.x86_64) Python version: 3.6.8 Spark / PySpark version: N/A OS and version: CentOS Linux release 7.8.2003 (Core) GCC version: 4.9.2 CMake version: 3.18.4
Checklist:
Did you search issues to find if somebody asked this question before? Y If your question is about hang, did you read [this doc] (https://github.com/horovod/horovod/blob/master/docs/running.rst)? Y If your question is about docker, did you read this doc? Y Did you check if you question is answered in the troubleshooting guide? Y
Bug report: Please describe erroneous behavior you're observing and steps to reproduce it. Installing horovo with command: <denchmark-code>CUDA_TOOLKIT_ROOT_DIR=/usr/local/cuda-10.1/ HOROVOD_WITH_TENSORFLOW=1 HOROVOD_WITHOUT_PYTORCH=1 HOROVOD_WITHOUT_MXNET=1 HOROVOD_NCCL_INCLUDE=/usr/include HOROVOD_NCCL_LIB=/usr/lib64 HOROVOD_CUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda-10.0 HOROVOD_CUDA_INCLUDE=/usr/local/cuda-10.0/include HOROVOD_GPU_OPERATIONS=NCCL HOROVOD_CPU_OPERATIONS=MPI HOROVOD_WITH_MPI=1 HOROVOD_WITHOUT_GLOO=1 pip install --no-cache-dir horovod </denchmark-code>
Output: <denchmark-code>Looking in indexes: http://mirrors.xxxx.com/pypi/simple Collecting horovod Downloading http://mirrors.xxx.com/pypi/packages/6f/bd/b979db25c1337967472630714d0f98ec596ad9f199a3d1777dc36453d713/horovod-0.20.3.tar.gz (3.2 MB) |████████████████████████████████| 3.2 MB 640 kB/s Requirement already satisfied: cloudpickle in /usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from horovod) (1.6.0) Requirement already satisfied: psutil in /usr/local/lib64/python3.6/site-packages (from horovod) (5.7.2) Requirement already satisfied: pyyaml in /usr/local/lib64/python3.6/site-packages (from horovod) (5.1.2) Requirement already satisfied: dataclasses in /usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from comments.comment: Please try setting <denchmark-link:https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/envvar/CUDACXX.html>CUDACXX</denchmark-link> to the nvcc compiler you would like to use instead of providing . cmake can bootstrap the location of the cuda libraries based on that.

Please try setting CUDACXX to the nvcc compiler you would like to use instead of providing CUDA_TOOLKIT_ROOT_DIR. cmake can bootstrap the location of the cuda libraries based on that.
I try CUDACXX and the error remains the same <denchmark-code>CUDACXX=/usr/local/cuda-10.1/bin/nvcc HOROVOD_WITH_TENSORFLOW=1 HOROVOD_WITHOUT_PYTORCH=1 HOROVOD_WITHOUT_MXNET=1 HOROVOD_NCCL_INCLUDE=/usr/include HOROVOD_NCCL_LIB=/usr/lib64 HOROVOD_CUDA_HOME=/usr/local/cuda-10.0 HOROVOD_CUDA_INCLUDE=/usr/local/cuda-10.0/include HOROVOD_GPU_OPERATIONS=NCCL HOROVOD_CPU_OPERATIONS=MPI HOROVOD_WITH_MPI=1 HOROVOD_WITHOUT_GLOO=1 pip install --no-cache-dir horovod </denchmark-code>
Could there be an issue with your system? Do you have /usr/local/cuda-10.1/include/?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/leezu>@leezu</denchmark-link> Definitely yes. I check and lots of output there

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/leezu>@leezu</denchmark-link> I compiled openmpi twice with different versions (first 3.1 and second 4.0). From the previours log I find cmake recognize it as version 3.1. Could this be the problem?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/leezu>@leezu</denchmark-link> I fix it! I mispell cuda path ( rather than which is actually installed) in other environment variables in the pip command.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/leezu>@leezu</denchmark-link> A new error: <denchmark-code>... /tmp/pip-install-9hq74cjb/horovod/horovod/tensorflow/mpi_ops.cc:24:42: fatal error: tensorflow/core/framework/op.h: No such file or directory #include "tensorflow/core/framework/op.h" ^ compilation terminated. ... </denchmark-code>
Do you have any ideas?
